snippet.textDisplay: mmm sorry I don't know, I bought it the first time for the dreamcast back in '06 really cheap, I love it, then my cousin who also loved the game found a copy in '09 and gave it to me, my GC was broken at the time, then in 2012 I finally got it fixed and bought a Wii from a friend and finally got the chance to play it (the copy was PAL format and my GC could not play it in a correct way, so the hacked Wii on the  forwarder could play it perfectly and I finally got the chance to play it again). Well the point is, im not sure but at Gamestop you can buy it at like $17 or at eBay, the thing is, you have to search really well because the copies of the game are hard to get
snippet.textOriginal: mmm sorry I don't know, I bought it the first time for the dreamcast back in '06 really cheap, I love it, then my cousin who also loved the game found a copy in '09 and gave it to me, my GC was broken at the time, then in 2012 I finally got it fixed and bought a Wii from a friend and finally got the chance to play it (the copy was PAL format and my GC could not play it in a correct way, so the hacked Wii on the  forwarder could play it perfectly and I finally got the chance to play it again). snippet.textDisplay: @Louis Claudel initially it was a Dreamcast exclusive, when the console died, It got a port for the Gamecube (the ps2 version was cancelled), you can play it on GC or even on a wii, that port has extended story and sidequest, I made a promise to myself last year and that was to complete the game 100%, I made it and it took me 63 hours to finish it on 103%, so if you are planning to play it, it maybe last 50 hours to get to the end, maybe when you have time you can give it a chance.
snippet.textOriginal: @Louis Claudel initially it was a Dreamcast exclusive, when the console died, It got a port for the Gamecube (the ps2 version was cancelled), you can play it on GC or even on a wii, that port has extended story and sidequest, I made a promise to myself last year and that was to complete the game 100%, I made it and it took me 63 hours to finish it on 103%, so if you are planning to play it, it maybe last 50 hours to get to the end, maybe when you have time you can give it a chance.

snippet.textDisplay: I actually thought it was weird something so jazzy was playing in abandoned ruins... I think the Town of Ice track captures the feeling better, but this track is better on its own merits.
snippet.textOriginal: I actually thought it was weird something so jazzy was playing in abandoned ruins... I think the Town of Ice track captures the feeling better, but this track is better on its own merits.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow, I haven't heard this tune for a while, but I'm amazed I somehow overlooked the laid back jazzy feel this song had. The dungeon itself was definitely a sight to behold, but this newfound element (well for me), has made this tune a new fav of mine!
snippet.textOriginal: Wow, I haven't heard this tune for a while, but I'm amazed I somehow overlooked the laid back jazzy feel this song had. The dungeon itself was definitely a sight to behold, but this newfound element (well for me), has made this tune a new fav of mine!

snippet.textDisplay:
Around the time I started getting into Skies, being 13 or so I had one of those old rf adapters for my tv with the cable/antenna wire, there was a tiny switch on the box that turned up the brightness and contrast to an insane degree for some reason and one day I noticed my picture was messed up.
I was I was just too dumb and young to realize it for a long time..so playing through the dungeon or whatever I had to look on the sub-map and just run on the ice path looking at the arrow cause it was all I could see. I don't honestly remember what the ice city looked like because of that.
snippet.textOriginal:
Around the time I started getting into Skies, being 13 or so I had one of those old rf adapters for my tv with the cable/antenna wire, there was a tiny switch on the box that turned up the brightness and contrast to an insane degree for some reason and one day I noticed my picture was messed up.
I was I was just too dumb and young to realize it for a long time..so playing through the dungeon or whatever I had to look on the sub-map and just run on the ice path looking at the arrow cause it was all I could see. I don't honestly remember what the ice city looked like because of that.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly as much as I loved the DC version I don't think the GCN version was really missing anything the DC version had.  Maybe the little VMU game with Pinta's Quest... that was kind of fun.  =)
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly as much as I loved the DC version I don't think the GCN version was really missing anything the DC version had.  Maybe the little VMU game with Pinta's Quest... that was kind of fun.  =)

snippet.textDisplay:
Funnily enough, I just recently finished this game. It is indeed an underrated gem, though it does have a few flaws.

I loved the Ice Dungeon too, probably my favourite in the game. Not only is the concept interesting, but there's no padding before or after this dungeon. You just get the Crystal and leave. A very refreshing change of pace. You don't even fight a Gigas, weight off my mind. Though personally, I'm surprised you still have yet to add "Ancient Temple Dungeon"  to this list. The way it's composed seems to be your cup of tea.
snippet.textOriginal:
Funnily enough, I just recently finished this game. It is indeed an underrated gem, though it does have a few flaws.

I loved the Ice Dungeon too, probably my favourite in the game. Not only is the concept interesting, but there's no padding before or after this dungeon. You just get the Crystal and leave. A very refreshing change of pace. You don't even fight a Gigas, weight off my mind. Though personally, I'm surprised you still have yet to add "Ancient Temple Dungeon"  to this list. The way it's composed seems to be your cup of tea.

snippet.textDisplay: Loved Skies of Arcadia.  Was introduced to it by my friend's DC version of the game, then later got it on Game Cube where I could actually play it.  I remember having a total crush on Aika at the time. :3
snippet.textOriginal: Loved Skies of Arcadia.  Was introduced to it by my friend's DC version of the game, then later got it on Game Cube where I could actually play it.  I remember having a total crush on Aika at the time. :3

snippet.textDisplay: Thumbs up for Aika.
snippet.textOriginal: Thumbs up for Aika.

snippet.textDisplay: This has always been a favorite of mine, awesomely relaxing with a nice jazzy touch. I remember having a hard time with this dungeon which was near the end of the game. This track perfectly reflects the sad tone of an abandoned city that was frozen in time under the thick layer of ice.
snippet.textOriginal: This has always been a favorite of mine, awesomely relaxing with a nice jazzy touch. I remember having a hard time with this dungeon which was near the end of the game. This track perfectly reflects the sad tone of an abandoned city that was frozen in time under the thick layer of ice.

snippet.textDisplay: The dungeon had a really nice ambiance, but i prefered seriously Rixis and Horteka, and the Low Valua. (about music)
snippet.textOriginal: The dungeon had a really nice ambiance, but i prefered seriously Rixis and Horteka, and the Low Valua. (about music)
